newsitem.title: USA: Teledesic names chief executive officer.
newsitem.headline: Teledesic names chief executive officer.

text.p: Teledesic Corp Wednesday named Northern Telecom Ltd executive David Twyver to be its first chief executive officer.
Twyver, president of wireless networks for Northern Telecom, will assume his position late this month.
Cellular telephone mogul Craig McCaw will continue to serve as chairman, and Russell Daggatt will remain president and chief operating officer.

Teledesic, founded in 1990 and principally owned by McCaw and Microsoft Corp chairman Bill Gates, plans to launch hundreds of satellites in low-Earth orbit to provide broadband voice and data connections to virtually every corner of the globe.
The $9 billion project aims to begin offering service in 2002.
